intro: Pyrenaria masocarpa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. Pyrenaria masocarpa thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
